New Records: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched five brilliant innings and gave up only two hits over five innings with one walk and two strikeouts
Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched a historic duel with San Diego hurler Yu Darvish â€” the contest was the first MLB postseason match-up between two Japanese-born starting pitchers.
Enrique Hernandez crushed a solo shot to left field to put the Dodgers up 1-0 in the second inning.
Teoscar Hernandez made it 2-0 in the seventh, launching a 420-foot blast into the left field seats.
Pre-Game Insights: Yoshinobu Yamamoto said he was determined to improve on a lackluster performance in the Dodgers' Game 1 win.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said he was confident Yoshinobu Yamamoto would rise to the occasion based on his past performances.
Post-Match Reflections: Padres manager Mike Shildt said Yu Darvish was magnificent again, but the Padres failed to score a run in the last 24 innings of the series.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said he was looking forward to riding Yoshinobu Yamamoto through the World Series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers completed a 3-2 series victory over the Padres in the best-of-five National League Division Series.
The Dodgers will host the New York Mets in Game 1 of the best-of-seven NLCS on Sunday.
The victory means Japanese superstar Shohei Ohtani will have a chance to battle for a World Series berth.
